intro: Senecio erythropappus, commonly known as the red pappus senecio, is a species of flowering plant in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive red bracts that surround its yellow flower heads. Its leaves are typically grayish-green and covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Senecio erythropappus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display and adaptability to various growing conditions.
